_label: 1931, 1932 P.T.A. Milk Fund, Superior Wis.
_Description: Two charity or cinderella stamps (NOT postage stamps) from a sheet issued at Christmas 1931. This shows a stylized green and white Christmas tree on a red background. White border blank area occupies the left half of the stamp. These would have been sold to raise money for the Milk Fund (providing milk for thse who couldn't afford it (P.T.A. implies it may have been aimed at school children) in Superior, Wisconsin. These stamps would have been stuck onto Chrtistmas card envelopes to brighten them up and spread awareness of the charity.
_Publication/creation: Superior : Superior (Wis.) P.T.A. Health Milk Fund, 1931.
keywords: Milk Fund,Superior,Fund,Milk

_label: In aid of the "Jack Cornwell" Ward at the Star & Garter Home.
_Description: 'Jack' Cornwell was wounded during the battle of Jutland in 1916 aboard the H.M.S. Chester and subsequently died, not yet 17 years old. He was awarded the Victoria Cross. This is a charity stamp with a portrait of him that would have been sold to raise funds for the ward named after him at the Star & Garter Home (presumably the one on Richmond Hill,Surrey) for severely disabled sailors and soldiers.
_Publication/creation: [Place of publication not identified] : ['Star and Garter' Fund], [1917?]
keywords: Jack Cornwell,Garter Home,years old,subsequently died

_label: Deuxième congrès national des équipes C.R.F. de secourisme : les cinq fondateurs / [Croix-Rouge française].
_Description: Presentation sheet of 5 stamps or gummed stickers commemorating 85 years (1864-1949) of the French Red Cross and the second national congress of its first aid teams, in Mulhouse, France. Unclear as to whether these were actual postage stamps, though each has 'France' in the upper left corner. Each stamp has an engraved portrait (Institut de Graveurs) of one of the founders : Gustave Moynier, Théodore Maunoir, Henri Dunant, Général G.-H. Dufour and Louis Appia. Printed in red and what appears to be a very dark green, but may be black that has changed with age.
_Publication/creation: [Place of publication not identified] : [publisher not identified], 1949.
keywords: les cinq fondateurs,national des équipes,Deuxième congrès national,les cinq
